ComicInfo.Title: Kids of Today (tsk, tsk); Phineas Goes to the Store!; "Get out from under my feet!"; Religious Nuts; The Rip; The Doomsters; Terror Under the Bed!; The Year is 3711; The Casebook of Doctor Feelgood; The Geniuses; Epidemic; #149 [The Hurry Tax]
ComicInfo.Notes: Tagged with the ninjas.walk.alone fork of ComicTagger 1.3.5 using info from Comic Vine on 2024-05-23 22:38:55. [CVDB175910] Tagged with ComicTagger 1.6.0a13.dev122 using info from Grand Comics Database on 2024-06-12 20:51:52. [Issue ID 277149]

ComicInfo.Summary:
Phineas goes to a head shop to get some rolling papers but winds up winning the store in a contest.
Dorman wants Ping to stay outside the house for a while after he gets under his feet.
Rowdy and friends sitting by the campire roasting hot dogs.
A nerd designs a hat with floppy ears to try to get humans to like their looks.
Dirty Billy rips off the tourists by saying he's Lawrence Ferlinghetti.
Getting a crew cut to beat the heat.
Getting in front of a car to cause a crash.
Melvin comes home early to catch Melba in the act.
What life is like in the dystopian year of 3711.
The hippie has too much coffee at the Catharsis Coffeehouse.
Clark Kent visits Doctor Feelgood because he feels washed up and can't right wrongs like he used to.
The different types of geniuses.
A hospital accident causes a cloud of Poltroonian Swine Fever to spread, causing the citizens of Muthalode city to have a ravenous, never-ending appetite.
Gilbert proposes a hurry tax, a way to speed up traffic signals that are on red.
